reply illvstriovs cardinall perron ansvveare excellent king great britaine first tome translated english imprinted dovay martin bogart vnder signe paris maiestie henrietta maria bovrbon qveene great brittaine yovr maiestie may please informed haue dedication deliuered right durst withhold challenge hath manie iust title giuen anie others protection done maiestie palpable iniutie daughter france therefore fittest owne worke time ornament countrie queene england therefore fittest patronize making english man famous frenchman kinge iames sonns wife therefore since misfortune time hath made presumption giue inheritance worke sent father frech sonne english whose proper right fittest receiue parte none make two one honor sexe let saie woeman though farr aboue woman therefore fittest protect woman worke plaine translation wherein nothing aimed rightlie expresse author intention may called worke last crowne addition catholicke zealous one therefore fittest receiue dedication catholickeworke besides doth appropriate particular maiestie professe selfe faithfull subiect humble seruant reader reader thov shalt heere receiue translation welintended wherein translator could haue noe end informe thee aright looke glorie translation beneath intention aimed would haue chosen late writer heere sawe stored vp much antiquitie would fitlie serue purpose desire haue noe guest catholique woman first serues mine honor second excuse since worke meanely done noe wonder sexe raise noe great expectation anie thing shall come yet great follie would expose view world worke kinde except iudged want nothing fitt translation therefore confesse thinke well done confest sufficientlie printing gaine noe applause hee writt faire hath lost labour haue done dare auouch hath bene fower church doth assemble one dare shew howse treatise faith creede wee beleeue holie church catholick heretickes schismatickes call congregation church hereticks beleeuing god false thinges violate faith sufficiencie person case wee argue noe vpon wordes probablie wee doe speake qualitie particular doctor argue therevpon demonstratiuelie shall remaine trulie vniuersall catholicke eminent father time lirinensis opposing vniuersalitie particularitie doctrine obseruation particular beginning could slipt ad spread vniforme vniuersall beleefe ad custome partes earth principallie soe father next vniuersall innouations could perceiue must needes vniuersallie obserued church must haue come vniuersall beginning age according beleefe minister two beginning vniuersall authoritie church wit either apostle generall councells yeild sea apostolicke anie vniversall authoritie therefore whatsoeuer vniuersallie vniformly obserued church prouinces earth time first fowre generall councells begun time bin practised saie bin anie generall councell church must necessarilie haue bin tradition apostle following rule augustin thinges said hee obserue epist writeing tradition kept ouer extent earth must vnderstood haue bin retained appointemet institution either apostle themselues generall councells whose authoritie wholsome church elsewhere custome soeuer men looking vpward de bapt cont l c discerne haue bene instituted later time rightlie beleeued haue bin instituted apostle manie would bee longe repeate againe anie one herein seeke diuine authoritie vniuersall c church obserues hath bin instituted councells hath alwaies bin held iustly beleeued haue bin giuen tradition apostolicall authoritie c rule augustin haue place thing father time first fowre councells testifie haue bin obserued iu church fowre first councells much ought haue thing father affirme termes equiualent expresslie haue bin instituted ordained apostle fiue obseruations made vpon thesis saie passe vnto hypothesis minister whose societie maiestie outwardlie adheres farr holding thinges father haue beleeued practised necessarie saluation synaxis church lirurgie seale ecclesiasticall communion fowre principall thinges haue seperated themselues v reall presence bodie christ sacrament oblation sacrifice eucharist prayer oblation dead prayer saint father haue vniuersallie vniformely beleeued holden practised thing necessarie different kindes necessitie vnto saluation meanes minister bene time father haue thinges renounced seruice communion must cause haue renounced seruice communion father consequently title societie catholicke church haue said reall presence bodie christ sacrament could haue gone farther said substantiall transition sacrament bodie christ wee call transubstantiation king answere knowing speake elect predestinate foundation vvorld coheires vnited bodie copartner promise god ghospell diuine apostle saith replie heere excellent kinge behaues like hippomanes runninge atalanta masterie cast golden apple way delaie takinge vp soe maiestie putt rubbes discourse staie course pen stoppe examine hope remoue quickly shall time enough end carrere succinctly saie fower thinges first philosopher teach v morall passion wee call hope whence theologicall hope hath analogy borowed name alwaies mingled tempred feare meanes whereof thinges fall vnder obiect hope good future life respect euery particular man cannot apprehended certaintie theologicall faith saie infaillible doubted otherwise hope noe vertue distinct fro faith oracle sainct pavl remaines faith hope charitie thing three ought embraced expectatio mingled tempered feare dauid exhortes v wordes ferue lordin feare reioyce tremblinge pavl thou subsistest faith pussed vp feare thinkes stand let take heede least againe worke saluation feare tremblinge speaking himselfe chastize bodie bring vnder least haue preached others myselfe become reprobate second faith cannot bee thing reuealed word god faith saith saint pavl hearing hearing word god reuealed anie one word god hath consigned church either writinge tradition absolutelie number predestinate therefore hee haue expresse particular reuelation god saint paule vpon occasion speakes somtimes himselfe according common condition simply one faithfull sometymes according extraordinary reuelatio predestinate person haue anie certaintie faith respect saie reuealed v scripture whosoeuer trustes lord shall cofounded thatpsa lord himselfe saith beleeues hath life eternall proioann mi speake modification scripture put ought vnderstood condition wherewith lord haue vnderstood hee saith perseuers end shall matt saued saint paule writes see goodnesse god thee thou rom perseuere goodnes otherwise thou shalt also cutt finall perseuerance particularly promised anie one word ofmarc god answere lord saith aske pray beleeue shall receiue shall done consequentlie demaunde perseuerance shall obtaine answere meanes demaunde demaunde principall condition required demaunde perseuerance demaunde perseuere demaundinge content selues demaundinge demaunde petpetually followinge preeept o saint paule pray without ceasinge againe1 thess watch pray perseuerance far salomon demaunded wisedome andephes begged faith without staggeringe condition wherewithiacob saint iames saith begge perseuere aske lost perseuerance aske wicked reprobate others proposed religion doctrine necessarie saluation doe thinke themselues obliged holde assuredly predestinate whatsoeuer sinnes commit shall infallibly haue leasure grace repent iohn speakes perfect charitie euery particular man ought desire presume hath feare loosinge loosinge humilitie feare saint iohn pretendes excluded excellent charity sanit avgvstine saith feare feare fielde necessary goe forth religion found visible world make new communion congregation parte see heere needefull proued steede excellent kinge aleageth anie member church departe rule faith church must preserr loue veritie loue vnitie answere answere two thinges first noe incompatibilitie beweene thesis must vnited vniuersall bodie catholicke church antithesis anie member departe rule faith must vnited one speakes bodie church speakes one member church speciall mention o one church departing true faith supposes staie perseuerace rest bodie church faith bodie whence parte forsakes faith deuides selfe wee say must haue communion vnitie parte separate selfe bodie meanes maintaine vnitie haue vnitie deuide themselues vnitie second great difference betweene rightes catholicke church preuiledges particular church infallible assistance holy ghost neuer promised euery particular church bodie catholicke church therefore element corruptible partes incorruptible soe church corruptible part incorruptible sorte though particular church may erre faith consequentlie cease beinge church neuerthelesse alwaies remaines one masse churche exempt corruptio soe greate eminent representes conserues herselfe beinge rightes prerogatiues whole soe obligation haue communicate catholicke church one thinge obligation haue communicate particular church wee bound communicate necessarily absolutely vnder paine anathema damnation communion none saued others onely while communicate pretence truth cannot alleadged make obligation conditionall since saint paule saith church fouudation apostolicall sea vpon subiect either especially african vniuersallie bishop feare least yet come holynesse pope ivlivs recitedathan apol saint athanasivs ignorant said hee arrians custome first write v hence may proceede iust decision thinges wordes constitution saint clemen vniuersall episcopat committed bishop chap xxiii continuance kinges answere read constitntions vniuersall committed bishop consequence sort amazed wee read beleiue replie neither booke beares title clemets constitution creditt haue aucthority decide matter religion beginninge supposed vnder clements name since alterd falsified heretickes certaine authority thereof suspected saint epiphanivs make mention booke soe intitled saith manie called question yet reiected councell constantinople surnamed held longe condemned photius patriarke constantinople yet c later saith hardly iustified arrianisme make writinge bore name saint epiphanius hath since bene salsified arrians neither doth booke either expressely equiualently bishop sort oecumenicall l c saith speakeinge collectiuely bishop distributiuely euery bishop wee write thinges confirmation l episcopat committed ouer said could followe doth saint common faith catholicke apostolicke truth againe flauianus hauing bene condemned congregation greeke bishop sea apostolicke alone consented thereunto absolued contrary wise authoritie condemned dioscorus prelate second sea bene approued alone annulled wicked synod consenting alone authoritie ordained councell chalcedon kept thing incident carry v away lett v againe returne careere councell chalcedon open first coplaint made dioscorus patriark alexandria presumed vndertake keepe generall councell president without commission pope vpon complaint also dioscorus came downe patriarkall seate wherein wasconc first sett stood middest place accused party andchalc act iudge wee haue handes said paschasinus bishop lylibea sicilia legat pope speaking councell commaundments blessed apostolicke prelate cittie rome head church whereby vouchsaffed ordaine prouisionallie dioscorus sit councell attempt cast lucentius ibid bishop also pope legate dioscorus said must yeild account iudgement much hauing noe right doe office iudge attempted presumed holde synod without authoritie sea apostolicke neuer hath bene lawfull neuer done euagrius narration history councell senat saith hauing legate leo heades historie first head saie caluinists donatist addressed themselues emperor constantine aske iudges true consequence drawe fro exaple donatistes alreadie schismatickesaug ep separated obedience communion church besides recourse afterward emperor iulian apostata pagan insidell prince recouer church christian catholicke prince taken elogie onely iustice remained andaug contr liter l cap ep head donatist appealed pope iudgement emperor iudgement true doth emperor crie appeale thing fitt spoken heard madd impudence furie recourse auenlie earthlie iudgement manifest contempt christ authoritie fowrth head notwithstanding protestation emperor graunted councell ark true doth saint avgvstine testifie irregular action saith emperor giuing waie peruersues ibidem donatist pope legate assistant councell rome present arles father councell bewailed pope could assist said bene present pronounced severe sentence donatist doth proue iudgement appeale ample reuiew cause donatist said doth testifie donatist noe agree emperorsibidem iudgement former emperor saith hee chosen iudge aug ep emperor iudging dispised ingenuitie caluin andcaluin inst l c disciple saie historie enough end couerted hope wee beleeued desired might purge himselfe shamefull blotts staines greef greefe hath bene eased confort wee haue bene deliuered affliction longer labour narration marcheth supplication consists three request first request pope noe easily receiue appeale africa premised saidcircamed office due salutation wee beseech affection doe easily admitt shall come hence receiue communion haue bene excommunicated v owne prouince haue bene depriued communion may seeme rashlie vnfitly restored communion holynesse request propt vp fiue reason first theconc c councell nicea forbidden bene excommunicated one prouince receaued communion reuerence said easilie acknowledge hath bene defined councell nicea although seemes restraine caution inferior clerk lay men much stroger reason intend allso bishop thing heate contention drew mouthes directlie avgvstine saith speaking cecilianus archishop carthage bene deposed councell seauentie african bishop assembled carthage hee might contemme conspiring multitude enemy knew himselfe vnited communicatorie aug epi letter roman church hath alwaies flourisht principalitie sea apostolick country whence ghospell first came africa councell nicea said hee moyses succeeded peter new church christ true priesthood hath bene committed hath caused father saie one chaire chaire peter chaire apostle placed witt adherence communion vnitie peter church begetts none catholicks onely selfe sara begate isaack onely herselfe rest church begets without selfe although ismael begotten bodie sara bodie agar yet sort begotten sara much begotten belonged sara saras nuptiall right witt seede abraham soe hereticks begotten baptisme church neuerthelesse church begetts euen church much baptisme whereby begotten baptise haue carryed church distinct nation language greekes yea euen haue seruice tongue quite different asmuch adhere creeke church particular roman church may also certaine regard called catholicke word catholicke taken three sortes witt either formallie causallie participatiuelie formally vniuersall church saie societie true particular church vnited one selfe communio called catholicke causallie roman church called catholicke much infuseth vniuersalitie whole bodie catholicke church soe costitute vniuersalitie must two thinges one may analogicallie insteede matter thereto witt multitude multitude noe vniuersalitie insteede forme thereto witt vnitie multitude without vnitie make noe vniuersalitie take awaie saith sainct avgvstine vnitie multitude tumult bring vnitie people thereforeaugust de verb domin secundum luc serm roman church center beginning ecclesiasticall communion infuseth vnitie forme vniuersalitie catholicke church consequent causeth vniuersalitie may called catholicke causallie though owne particular noe lesse galley gallies fleete haue relation dependancie correspondencie called generall although bee one particular galley relation others haue giues vnitie totall generall bodie fleete finallie particular church called catholicke participatiuely agree participate doctrine communion catholicke church sence church smyrna addresseth epistle catholick church philomilion catholick church throughout world cause wherefore roman church hath cutt rest communion chap x continuance king answere exclude communion rest dissent anie thinge refuse yoake slauerie replie excellent king may pleased remember two thing one antient author haue written oftentimes one word contrarie faith manie heresy haue bene cast bodie church society egiptians ethiopian haue bene xii continuance king answere alone attribute yourselues right others also doe daie word king cannot speake without groaning manie particular church beleeue themselues onelie particular people call might seeme iudge impartiallie third sainct chrysostomes ayme treate seriouslie markes church pagan stopp mouthes shew whereas said would turne christian knew part range themselues pretence true language fowrth hee stopps acknowledging meanes subtletie shiftes hereticks sufficient requires exactes saie hee reduceth last instance summe question point true church hath remained stedfast immutable communion whence others gone forth came forth none pagan saith hee come saith would turne christian chrysost act ho know ought adhere amongst manie strife sedition tumultes know opinion choose ought preferr euerie one saith followe truth shall vtterlie ignorant scripture beleeue seeing side well catholickes sect arrians shall appeare heereafter protest thinge certainly answereth hee make much v wee saie wee must beleeue reason thou shalt without cause troubled wee saie wee must beleeue scripture simple true easie thee iudge thereof anie one conforme himselfe christian anie striue farr rule become saith gentile coming also saie scripture affirmes thinge thou saist affirmes thinge wrest scripture diuers part drawing vnderstanding word thereof owne side c saith chrisostome inquire pagan saith pretence excuse aske ifhe condemne gentile hee must saie thinge desire come v till first condemne wee aske cause condemnes condemne without cause manifest saie god creature vncreated god well answere wee found heresy clause euidently shewes spoke onely heresy opposed christ east afflicted wee affirme contrarie neede word wee confesse christ god see combat combates wee call god pronounce thinges worthie god hath power seruile sree doth thinges contrary finallie seeing attempt succeeded sufficiently possible saith hee heares without preoccupation perswaded rule according thinges squared noe neede great consideration would easie discerne make wrye line euen soe nowe wheresore would saie doe see preiudication human cause doe manie thinges reply saie also v saie wee haue seperated ourselues haue made noe schisme diuision chrysost church wee haue noe heresiarchs wee name ourselues ibidem name anie man wee haue noe leader one marcion another manicheus arius heresifounder wee take appellatio anie particular began anie heresie preside ouer v gouerne church wee haue noe doctor vpon earth god forbid wee haue one alone heauen also hee saie others likewise affirme name beare answereth hee witt marcionites manichee arrians conuinceth stopps mouthes word appeares last analysis resolution question determined point true church hath remained defence nay assisted soe great strength spirit many flouds eloquence great number protector much likelyhood manie oracle diuine lawe expounded new naughtie manner seemes conspir aice could neuer haue bene destroyed imbraced defended extolled profession noueltie end left cause soe great motion alone abandoned discipline church blame taxed discipline church haue receiued without expiation preceding pennance persecution time denied christ communicated sacrifice pagan consequently haue bene polluted contagion pagan accused hauing receaued conuerted heretickes communion without giuing true baptisme could giuen according church consequently haue polluted communion contagion vnbaptised vncircumcised spirituallie haue lost true church could subsist without true vse sacramets made profession manner conuersation life much better ruled reformed catholickes whence avgvstine forbidds catholicks reproche donatist anie otheridem cont lit petilian l c thing catholickes called themselues little flocke lord two tribe kingdome iuda said hauing nothing possessing thing wee account soule rich paine blood purchase treasure heauen breese supposed themselues haue reason separation reputed catholickes worthie much name christian hauing lost true vse baptisme whereby men made christias spake said caius seius caia seia man thou christian woeman wilt thou christian cryed themidem come yee ignorant recall donatist refractory communio accustomed admirable charitie prouide euen te mporall commodity bishop conuerted others also roman church knitt againe loue good betweene english church hath first donatist bishop still remained donatus partie would returne communion catholicke church roman church hath excommunicated bull returne english diuision catholick communion many admonition obstinate still remaine separation therefore antithesis betweene proceeding antient catholicke church moderne concerning word thunderboltes bull thinke make pope censure odious maiestie may remember please antient phrase speeche grecian vse called condemnation euen secular iudgementes thunderboltes expresse one condemned iudgment would saie thunderstrucken innocencie church matter conspiracy maiestie
